main event: A sighting of a circular horizontal plane that appeared as a silvery white reflection of the sun, resembling a thin beam of light, and vanished without a trace after 90 seconds.
interesting points: The object was initially observed as a bright reflection at one end, gradually appearing as a thin beam of light as the aspect changed.
The observer, a highly experienced pilot and controller, was familiar with the appearance of contrails and observed no unusual tracks.
The director of intelligence suggested that the object may have been a research balloon but the short duration of sighting and excellent weather conditions made this explanation unlikely.
The report indicates that there were numerous aircraft tracks in the vicinity of the sighting and a balloon launch schedule from a nearby location.
The sighting took place under clear, unlimited visibility, as documented in the report.
